title.narrative: 205 GENERATE DEMAND FOR POSITIVE PRACTICES IN NUTRITION

description.narrative: By 2022, government and partners have enhanced capacities to generate demand for positive practices that improve the nutritional status of children, adolescents and women, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Childhood Development, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Business and Key Business Stakeholders demonstrate growing willingness, commitment and resource allocation for protecting and promoting child rights in policy and practice by 2022

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, government and partners have enhanced capacities to generate demand for positive practices that improve the nutritional status of children, adolescents and women

description.narrative: Capacity of Government and partners was enhanced on nutrition Social Behavior Change Communication (SBCC) through the development of evidence based, costed, budgeted SBCC plan of actions. This resulted in the SBCC plans being implemented in 242 districts on Infant & young chodl feeding, 120 districts on addressing SAM and 286 districts on adolescent nutrition/anemia. The training cum communication package for panchayat representatives is rolled to 25 aspirational district in 7 States. The Jan Andolan dashboard recorded 36 million JA activities during Poshan Month September 2019 campaign which is a steep rise of 16% from 2.2 million recorded in Sep 2018. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: Country Programme incorporates early stimulation, protection and nutrition packages targeting children aged 0-3 (Including Care for Child Development)

Number of districts implementing government-endorsed social and behaviour change communication strategy (SBCC) or Plans of Action (PoA) with approved budgets and training and communications package for community-based management of SAM as per plan

Number of districts implementing government-endorsed social and behaviour change communication (SBCC) strategy or Plans of Action (PoA) with approved budgets and training and communications package for reduction of anaemia and maternal and adolescent malnutrition (Adolescent)

Number of districts implementing government-endorsed social and behaviour change communication (SBCC) strategy or Plans of Action (PoA) with approved budgets and training and communications packages for improved foods and feeding for children of 6 to 23 months of age
National level and number of states having functional partner alliances for scaling up of social and behaviour change communication (SBCC) strategies for women, adolescent and child nutrition.
